comment_data.diff_hunk:

   xfree(parsed_args.desc);
 }
 
+/// abbrmap_array: Retrieves abbreviation mappings for a specified mode and buffer.
+///
+/// @param int_mode The integer representation of the mapping mode (e.g., insert, command).
+/// @param buf      Pointer to the buffer for which the mappings are to be retrieved.
+///                 If NULL, global mappings are retrieved.
+/// @param mappings Pointer to an array where the retrieved mappings will be stored.
+static void abbrmap_array(int int_mode, buf_T *buf, Array *mappings)

comment_data.body:
Now I think this is a bit verbose. Maybe just this:
```suggestion
• Mapping APIs now support abbreviations when mode short-name has suffix "a".
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,7 +159,8 @@ The following new APIs and features were added.
 • |nvim_win_text_height()| computes the number of screen lines occupied
   by a range of text in a given window.
 
-• |nvim_set_keymap()| and |nvim_del_keymap()| now support abbreviations.
+• |nvim_set_keymap()|, |nvim_buf_set_keymap()|, |nvim_del_keymap()|, |nvim_get_keymap()|,

   by a range of text in a given window.
 
-• |nvim_set_keymap()| and |nvim_del_keymap()| now support abbreviations.
+• |nvim_set_keymap()|, |nvim_buf_set_keymap()|, |nvim_del_keymap()|, |nvim_get_keymap()|,
+  |nvim_buf_get_keymap()|, |nvim_buf_del_keymap()| now support abbreviations.

comment_data.body: I don't think this change is correct.

Hmm, this is even stranger, as it only gives an error for a space but still treats any other invalid mode short-name as nvo-mode. It should either be consistent with the checks in `modify_keymap()` or never give an error.

I think is better to just use an `:inoreabbr` and a `:cnoreabbr <buffer>` mapping here instead of two expression mappings, so that you won't need the `callback = nil` below and it is less verbose. Another test case for `!a` mode will also be good.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -460,6 +460,65 @@ describe('nvim_get_keymap', function()
       desc = 'map description',
     }, api.nvim_get_keymap('n')[1])
   end)
+
+  it('can get abbreviations map', function()
+    exec_lua [[
+      local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+      local GlobalCount = 0
+      vim.api.nvim_set_keymap('ia', 'foo', '', {
+        expr = true,
+        callback = function()
+          return tostring(GlobalCount)
+        end,
+      })
+
+      vim.api.nvim_buf_set_keymap(bufnr, 'ca', 'bar', '', {
+        expr = true,
+        callback = function()
+          return tostring(GlobalCount)
+        end,
+      })
+    ]]

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

title: feat(api): support abbr in nvim_get_keymap and nvim_buf_get_keymap
